learning_objectives.objective: Define security unit testing and recall key OWASP WSTG categories relevant to it (e.g., IVT, AUT, ATH, SST, CRYP, Client-side Testing).
Explain the integration of security unit testing into the Secure Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) and its extension from standard unit testing.
Implement a security unit test for a code snippet vulnerable to common issues like SQL injection (IVT) or weak cryptography (CRYP) using tools like JUnit or Pytest.
Compare security unit testing with other phases like integration testing, SAST, or DAST, identifying strengths and limitations.
Critique the effectiveness and coverage of a given security unit test suite, assessing risk mitigation for high-risk code units.
Design a comprehensive security unit test suite for a module (e.g., login handler) covering multiple OWASP categories and integrating into CI/CD.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Security Unit Testing (topic hierarchy: Cybersecurity > 008_Application Security > Secure Software Development Lifecycle > 008_Security Testing and Verification > Specialized Security Testing > Security unit testing). Use the provided learning objectives (spanning Bloom's Taxonomy: remember/understand, apply/analyze, evaluate/create), active learning components (discussion, peer teaching, problem-solving), 4 scaffolding layers (Foundation > Components > Implementation > Integration), and flashcard schema. Generate 40-60 high-quality flashcards covering: - All Bloom's levels (10-15% remember, 20% understand, 30% apply/analyze, 20% evaluate, 20% create). - All scaffolding layers proportionally. - OWASP WSTG categories comprehensively: INFO, CFG, IDM, AUT, ATH, SST, IVT, ERR, CRYP, BLT, Client-side Testing (complete with examples like DOM XSS prevention). - Voter priorities: Completeness (full WSTG adaptation, client-side), pedagogy (tie to activities). - Sources: OWASP WSTG, NIST. Output ONLY in JSON array of flashcards, each as: {"type": "mcq/cloze/etc.", "front": "...", "back": "...", "bloom_level": "apply", "layer": "3_implementation", "explanation": "Detailed... with distractor rationale, OWASP ref, real-world tie-in."}. Ensure active learning integration (e.g., MCQs on debate points), distractors per protocol (plausible errors), explanations per requirements. Make engaging, university-level, with code snippets where apt (e.g., Python/Javascript). Balance formats.
